page.title: 02Farming (Part1)
page.content: {Gelligaer Region Gelliargwellt and Tir-y-rhen farms cover most of the agricultural land with a total combined area of almost 500 acres.They are farmed as one unit concentrating almost solely on milk production,with a milking herd of 180 Freisian cows,2 bulls,3 beef steers,50 yearlings and 48 calves,making a total herd of 283.Most of the land is intensively managed grass land for grazing and silage production,about 150 tons of silage being produced annually.A small amount of Kale is also grown.There are 11 acres of woodland within the farm boundary containing mainly Oak,Ash,Scots Pine and Beech.Beech is also the main constituent of the hedges within the farm.There are also 40 acres of enclosed moorland used for rough grazing,and 1 acre of green wet land.
